I am highly  motivated and driven individual with a C hemical Engineer ing background  who has already gained 
significant practical experience to date. My positive approach to tackling technical and project challenges, through a 
collaborative and team focused approach, ha s enabled me to deliver positive business outcomes. As a key part of  
continuin g my professional development,  I continuously seek  opportunities to challenge myself to build my 
knowledge and competence , both technically and behaviourally.

Safety  at Port Talbot CURRICULUM VITAE  
 
  
 Page 1 of 2 Personal Profile  
I am highly  motivated and driven individual with a C hemical Engineer ing background  who has already gained 
significant practical experience to date. My positive approach to tackling technical and project challenges, through a 
collaborative and team focused approach, ha s enabled me to deliver positive business outcomes. As a key part of  
continuin g my professional development,  I continuously seek  opportunities to challenge myself to build my 
knowledge and competence , both technically and behaviourally.  
Work History  
March 2020  to Present – Process Safety Engineer at Tata Steel Europe  
I currently work as part of the central SHE department by supporting one of the manufacturing areas with Process 
Safety  at Port Talbot Steelworks . I am currently responsible for Process Saf ety in the Iron & Burdening works area  
including : two Blast Furnaces  and associated water -cooling  systems , Gas Cleaning Plant, Hot Blast Stoves, 
Granulated Coal Injection Plant  (GCI)  and Sinter Plant . 
For all the Major Accident Hazard (MAH) scenarios in the Iron & Burdening  area I am responsible for:  
- Ensuring all the relevant process safety information is correct and up to date (PFD’s, P&ID’s, Basis of Safety, 
Relief Valve Dossier, Heat & Mass Balances  etc.). 
- Regularly re viewing  all HazOp’s, LoPA’s, PHR’s  with an interdisciplinary team .  
- Creating bowties detailing all Process Safety Critical Equipment & Tasks (PSCE & PSCT).  
In my role I also support the area with the following:  
- Scribing in Haza rd Studies (HS1 -6, HazOp, PHR, LoPA) . 
- Management of change process , including facilitating regular MOC tracking sessions . 
- Process safety incident investigations  (Management & Supervisory investigations) . 
- Consequence modelling . 
- Barrier Management audits . 
- Process safety lead and lag KPI tracking  to update the Senior Management Team . 
- Facilitating  monthly  Process Safety Steering meeting in Iron & Burdening  for the Senior Management Team .  
- Engaging with regulator s (Health and Safety Executive ). 
- Deputising for Process Safety team leader  when required.  
I am also currently responsible for Project Managing a process safety improvement project in the Iron & Burdening 
area and working towards a Level 4 NVQ in Project Management  and a NEBOSH national general certificate . 
September 2019 to March 2020 – Graduate Chemical Engineer at Tata Steel Europe  
Working as  a graduate Process Engineer within the site -wide Process Engineering team  who are  responsible for 
the p rocess engineering design  of site -wide projects including process optimisation and process safety 
improvements.  
• ROSOV Improvement Project  - A process safety  project associated with  the mitigation of impacts arising 
from loss of containment of hazardous inventories via emergency isolation. I have been responsible for 
reviewing  and improving  the implementation of Remotely Operated Shut-Off Valves (ROSOV s) in line with 
the HSE Good Pra ctice (HSG244) across a Top Tier COMAH site  to ensure compliance . 
• Oil Reclamation Project  – I was responsible  developing the ‘As -built’ P&ID configuration for an oil 
reclamation process  through a series of plant walk downs and inspections . The ‘As-built’ P&ID  will be  used  to 
conduct  a retrospective HAZOP study  and identify any requirements  for additional  protection  measures  and 
implement  improvement s actions to ensure risks are  As Low as Reasonably Practicable (ALARP).  
September 2018 to September 2019  – Project  Technician at Power and Water  
Alongside stud ying my master’s degree,  I work ed part time as a Laboratory Technician for a company who design 
and manufacture Sono -electrochemical water treatment systems for a range of applications.  I was responsible for 
testing and analysis of all samples, running bench top reactors, using pilot plant equipment and compiling findings 
into report s to hand to prospective clients.  These included Agriculture, Aquaculture, Mining and Wastewater 
samples from several  different countries. Always striving for continuous improvement, as part of

Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
